title: Functional logic programming
text:
Functional logic programming is the combination, in a single <a href="programming%20language">programming language</a>, of the paradigms of <a href="functional%20programming">functional programming</a> and <a href="logic%20programming">logic programming</a>. This style of programming is embodied by , including <a href="Curry%20%28programming%20language%29">Curry</a> and <a href="Mercury%20%28programming%20language%29">Mercury</a>.
A <a href="scientific%20journal">journal</a> devoted to the integration of functional and logic programming was published by <a href="MIT%20Press">MIT Press</a> and the European Association for Programming Languages and Systems between 1995 and 2008.
